ENTRY.SYNOPSIS: Adjust the tg_d values of LETG/HRC-S evt2 data to make cross-dispersion profiles more symmetric

DESC.PARA:
&cltool; reads in an LETG/HRC-S evt2 file (usually this will be the output of the detilt command) and adjusts the TG_D values of all events. This makes the cross-dispersion profiles more symmetric about TG_D=0 so that EEFRAC values (used in the gRMF) will be accurate even when using narrower-than-standard spectral extraction regions. See
Corrections to TG_D for Wiggles, Tilt, and Asymmetry
for details. Only TG_D values are affected; the output file will not exhibit any changes if displayed in sky or detector coordinates.

&cltool; is generally used in combination with the dewiggle and detilt commands--also contributed software tools--to prepare LETG/HRC-S spectra so that narrower spectral extraction regions can be used to improve the S/N of low-S/N data.
Run the program with the clobber parameter enabled.
Input FITS file event list with columns TG_D and TG_MLAM.
Output FITS file event list with modified TG_D column.
File containing the TG_D correction as a function of wavelength.
Controls the amount of information tool prints to the screen.
